This means (6,8) is clear (not occupied by me), so LEFT move would technically be allowed from a collision point of view. But rules about not going backward into your own neck (the position right behind the head on the body) still apply: going LEFT from (7,8) would be (6,8) which is not occupied, but was the previous head before current? Our previous move was RIGHT from (7,7) to (7,8). So position (6,8) was never in the snake's recent body, so no collision or illegal reverse move. But need to check if LEFT is losing.

However, going back LEFT now (from 7,8 to 6,8) is allowed, not a reverse because the body at (7,7) is behind the head at (7,8). So moving LEFT is actually allowed.

- LEFT (6,8): No snake body or threat here, safe to move here.
- RIGHT (8,8): '.' open space, safe.

So actually, DOWN is illegal (would be 180 reverse into my body), UP unsafe (threat), LEFT and RIGHT are safe.
